content.description: Start at ground level, clipping the bolts. Goes through some loose/poor quality rock through a few bolts to a lip. Clip the bolt above the lip, pull a reachy move over the lip and move up through thinner moves on good rock to the anchors.
content.location: Early part of Impact Zone, at trail level past Blood, Sweat and Chalk. Starts to the right of the huge block (the huge block is the start of No Weld).

content.description: A fun strenuous route featuring steep climbing and great position out on a buttress. Begin on Barnacle Bill and after the first few bolts go left around the buttress on big holds andup through the bulging section (crux).  It is run out towards the top but the difficulty eases off significantly.
content.location: This climb shares start with Barnacle Bill (5.11b). Follow Barnacle Bill for a few bolts between good horizontals. Just below small blocky roof go left on jugs passing a bolt and rock up to good holds out on face. Gain stance and then continue up easier ground to top. Use long draws in beginning to avoid rope drag

content.description: Climb the face for 2 bolts (shared with Van Idle Route 1), then climb up and right to a 3rd bolt near the base of a blocky arete.  Continue up the blocky arete for 2 more bolts to the anchor.
content.location: Franklin's Impact Zone - Hike the trail uphill from the parking lot past the Contact Zone, past most of the Impact Zone, and past the section of talus that marks the trail's highest point. As the trail descends past a downstream-facing section of cliff, turn the corner and continue to the next section of downstream-facing cliff. Van Idle Routes 1 & 2 (Left and Right variations) start right where the trail meets this section of downstream-facing cliff.

content.description: Climb the face for 3 bolts (first 2 bolts shared with Van Idle Route 2), avoiding a couple of loose flakes on the left, to the first roof.  Traverse left, low or high, around the roof and climb up to an another corner.  Climb up and back right to the anchor.
content.location: Franklin's Impact Zone - Hike the trail uphill from the parking lot past the Contact Zone, past most of the Impact Zone, and past the section of talus that marks the trail's highest point. As the trail descends past a downstream-facing section of cliff, turn the corner and continue to the next section of downstream-facing cliff. Van Idle Routes 1 & 2 (Left and Right variations) start right where the trail meets this section of downstream-facing cliff.

content.description: Moderate climbing to the first bolt. Getting to the second bolt is a little tricky with bad fall consequences. I went right, up, then left to clip bolt 2, but there are chalked up holds going left over the arching roof of the tunnel entrance. A couple big moves and crimps around bolts 3-4.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Bolted anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Walk past Castaways and First Aid towards the tunnel but don't go through it. This is first line on the right of the tunnel entrance. Just left of Decompression Sickness.

content.description: Starts out on some steep climbing which ends with a big move over the roof getting up and past the 4th bolt. Continue past a short slabby section to another roof 5 ft below the anchors. Go direct on some thin moves to gain the anchor, and don't bail out left, or right to get to the anchors because you'll miss the last crux! This route packs quite the punch for such a short route.
content.location: Part of the section of the cliff called the Impact Zone. Located on a ledge system that can easily be accessed through a tunnel that I completely missed the first time around. Located two routes to the left of Belly of the Whale.

content.description:
A dramatic, clean splitter through a roof? Solid (eventually) gear in good stone? Wait, are you sure we're still in Franklin?

You need to fight your way through some of the dirtiest rock in the area to access this climb, but it is worth it for those looking to bag a hard, no BS roof crack.

~30 feet of easy climbing up bad rock will take you to the base of the crack splitting the roof. The crux is establishing at the lip of the crack and gaining on the headwall, where the crack continues until 3 feet shy of the anchor bolts. Burly!
content.protection: Fingers to hands, with extra emphasis in the .75-#3 range. Fat bolt anchors.
content.location: Obvious roof ~200 feet left of Aqualung. Delicate climbing up chossy ledges will gain the base of the route. Climb the broken crack  and corner to gain the obvious 10 foot splitter through the roof.

content.description: Clip a high first bolt from a good jug and pull through a few letter boxes to a good rest.  Stay left on two distinct bulges and finish on sweet holds to the anchors
content.protection: 7 bolts to a double- bolt anchor (9 draws).
content.location: The end of the Impact Zone just before the trail starts to ascend and the cliff fades out.  To get there, you'll scramble through a break in a boulder and look around the corner to the left.

content.description:
The last bolted route in the Impact Zone before the talus field that separates the last dozen upstream routes from the rest of the crag.

Climb a chossy pedestal to a high first bolt, move up through STEEP territory to a perch below the final bolt and thin finish moves.
content.location: Last route upstream before talus field/Hard Thing.  Rap or lower from anchors.

content.description: Climb the pocketed face immediately left of Castaways to a small roof. Â Don't be fooled though, the crux is clearing the roof and clipping the lone bolt on the smooth face above before hitting the anchors.
content.location: 10ft left of Castaways

content.description: Fun roped boulder problem about 100 feet up and left of Blood, Sweat, and Chalk.
content.location: About 100 feet up and left of Blood, Sweat, and Chalk.

content.description: Start on a ledge left of Wintermute and climb a pocketed/broken face to a small roof before the anchors. Â Consider a Â medium sized cam in the middle of the face to reduce the runout.
content.location: 15ft left of Wintermute on a wide ledge.

climbs.name: Neptune (?)
climbs.fa: Gray? Fisher? Powell? Needs more info.

content.description:
Nice mix of crack and face climbing on good stone.

Start with a short handcrack in a shallow right facing corner and transition to good face holds to reach the high first bolt. The second bolt protects a short section of fingerlocks or laybacks through a left facing corner, eventually traversing right to gain the face and third bolt. Cruxy moves through the short, second roof lead to more casual face climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts to rings. A long runner on the second bolt is needed to eliminate drag.
content.location: Bolt line just left of Aqualung.

content.description: Climb up on OK rock and traverse right  to a stance below the largest section of roof.  Climb through the crux roof to a strenuous clip above the roof and the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts and bolt anchors.  Beware of your rope running over the sharp edge on the roof when lowering.
content.location: Franklin's Impact Zone - Hike the trail uphill from the parking lot past the Contact Zone, past most of the Impact Zone, and past the section of talus that marks the trail's highest point.  As the trail descends past a downstream-facing section of cliff, turn the corner and continue to the next section of downstream-facing cliff.  Mostly Harmless is the farthest left and uphill on this face.

content.description:
This is the long trail-to-rim route just left of Jump Start, about 30 feet right of Bird of Prey.

Climb the tricky arete crux low, move up left around some scary blocks and continue up a steep wall to a roof.  Move left through the final crux and boulder problem to the anchors.
content.location: Directly left of Jump Start.

content.description: Climb up the flat face to the first bolt, trending up and right to the roof/corner arete, pulling right and onto the upper face, clipping the second bolt. Move straight up through the third bolt to the anchors. Take care when clipping the second bolt: the moves are not difficult but if you blow if you will hit the ground.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor. Optional #0.75 in the horizontal slot at the roof will protect to the 2nd bolt.
content.location: Impact Zone, on the ledge that requires going through the tunnel. Right of Super Amazing Sea Monkeys (big roof) and left of Belly of the Whale.

content.description: A fun line that can be done a number of ways to get to the first bolt. Campus, boulder, move in from the left, or for the full value original start jump to the start hold right of the first bolt. Lots of good jugs with a balancey section getting past the last bolt to the anchor. A great route to do at the end of the day.
content.location: Located on the right side of the Impact Zone. Just left of a really steep section of rock that appears to house a route with a project on it since the first two bolt hangers are still missing.

content.description: A long route with the crux at the top and sustained steep climbing getting there.  You might not want to follow the bolt line straight to the shuts- evaluate your options.  Well worth doing despite what the start looks like.
content.location: From Barnacle Bill continue around the next buttress and you will see a chossy gully in a corner.  Look up high on the clean right wall of the gully and find the line of bolts.  Follow it down and find the start on some easy chossy rock.

content.description: Climb the pocketed face left of Castaways with a single bolt to a ledge at 15ft, continue up the orange face above through a small roof to anchors.
content.location: 20ft right and slightly uphill from Wintermute

content.description: Crux is moving past the roof on the right.  Slightly committed step up on small holds.
content.location: Located in the "Impact Zone" in the corner just before the tunnel.  Locate the triangular roof about 12 feet up with bolt on the lip.

content.description: Despite the long approach and the routeÂs short height, Edge-u-cation is one of the most unique and best climbs at Franklin. For slab lovers a must do. Follow narrow crack past first bolt then traverse right and move up slab on good crimps to anchors above.
content.location: Main Area: Upper Tier Â Right Side: Extreme right end of wall, uphill from Rock Your World. Start at base of large boulder and climb beautiful orange colored slab.

content.description: Start with easy climbing to a high first bolt, than make some fun heady moves to a nice ledge to rest.  Take a good rest because getting onto and up the arÃªte is the crux.  Fun quick route, around 30 feet.
content.location: Follow past First aid to the opposing face. The first bolt line is Eddie's ArÃªte.

content.description: The route starts out with a high first bolt on what appears to be good looking rock. However I found the rock to be very flakey, and the first bolt is pretty sketch with bad fall potential. Getting past the bolt is the crux which ends on a good ledge 15 feet below the anchor. The flake out left could be supplemented with 2" gear to take the sting out of the runnout to the anchor, but it's limestone so it probably won't help if you were to pitch. In my opinion this route is not recommended since there is a substainial amount of loose rock just left of the boltline that I wasn't able to avoid standing on to get to the upper ledge.
content.protection: 3 bolts, optional 2" cam and anchor bolts.
content.location: Located 40' uphill and right of Jump Start past a steep section of rock at the Impact Zone.

content.description:
Big moves, crimps, jugs even a roof! Decompression Sickness is the sickness! Never mind its sandbagged reputation, get on it!

Start on face and climb up and left around buttress. Use long draws on first few bolts to cut down on rope drag. Move through a crimpy section to good stance just below a small roof. From here power straight up roof on jugs to easier ground and anchors or traverse ten feet left to the excellent alternate route The Bends (5.11c).
content.location: Main Area Â Impact Zone: Start in front of big buttress just left of Barnacle Bill.

content.description: The incredible tiered roof below Early Retirement, two lines downhill from Rock Your World, just right of the old location of Two Bolts to Nowhere.  Bolted and worked by Michael Fisher and Mike Gray, finally fell to a prolonged siege by Fisher, Clarke, and Ryan Eubank.  Dynamic, sustained, and still a bit crumbly in a few spots, sure to please fans odf the STEEEEEEP!
content.protection: Draws and rap anchors... and a healthy pair of huevos doesn't hurt, either...
content.location: Just uphill from Jump Start, under the obvious gigantic roof.  Lower from anchors and have someone TR this to clean... trollying in is a b*tch-kitty.

content.description: Pumpy route for a 5.8.  Crux is after the third bolt with awkward left hand/left foot holds to faith right hand hold and difficult fourth clip.
content.location: bolted line to the left of First Aid

content.description: A deservedly popular and possibly slightly sandbagged route.  Steep sustained climbing on big holds.
content.location: From the first bunch of climbs ascend to the second tier (aka Impact Zone) and this is the first route you see right in front of you ascending an orange streaked face with lots of chalk on it.

content.description:
NEW line as of 12/13/12.

This one will require some trickery!

Climb a very easy vertical face past one bolt (watch for a loose rock or two at the start), then punch it out the 10' dead horizontal roof. The route is essentially a bolted boulder problem. A single tight hands jam seemed mandatory, but this isn't the crack posted on rockclimbing(dot)com. I haven't been able to find that line. I'm not sure about the grade, but 12d seems fair. Climb it! I doubt you'll be disappointed!
content.location: The general location is: right of Blood, Sweat, and Chalk, left of Castaways. The climb begins uphill and left from two routes of similar character (vertical with a small roof/overlap at midheight), one of which begins on a pedestal. Scramble up a small hill from these routes to reach the base under a large roof. There are two routes here. Black Magic is the left route that climbs straight out the center of the roof using a seam and 1' right facing corner.

content.description: Climb through straightforward moves for the first 3 bolts, then pull over the bulge on slopers through the last bolt to the anchors.
content.location: Towards the end of the Impact Zone, in the alcove where Shipwreck is. The climb is the short, white face with incuts on the face, and slopey holds on the bulge near the anchors.

content.description: Climb the first few bolts of Decompression Sickness and traverse left to gain the clean orange face and roof of The Bends.
content.protection:
Bolts to shuts.

Can also be led as a mixed route. Gain the face by leading up the loose, gear-protected corner, starting on the chossy pedestal near the natural tunnel. The corner takes cams ranging from fingers-tight hands, med-large nuts).
content.location: Variation of Decompression Sickness. Locate the orange face capped by a 3-4 foot roof, directly above the natural tunnel.

content.description: Crux is moving past the second bolt, which is at waist hight during the crux.  The rest of the climb is easy.  First bolt is pretty high off of the ground.  There is much chalk slightly to the left of the line which can be misleading.  Climb starts directly below the first bolt.
content.location: Impact zone left, through the tunnel and across the ledge to far side, on right side of alcove.

content.description: Start with the first 4 bolts of Barnacle Bill, then transition/traverse right through a chossy cleft/corner (beware loose rocks) with hand crack in the back, place a piece or 2 (BD #1-3 cams) continue up and right to the first bolt of Anchored Away and continue straight up through the last 3 bolts to the anchors for Anchors Away.
content.protection: 8 bolts, a couple cams and cold shuts
content.location: Shares start with Barnacle Bill.

content.description: Possibly the most popular (and for good reason) route of this grade here.  The first 1/2 is steep climbing on good holds but don't dally because the pump is sneaking up on you.  The crux is nailing the long moves to the big thankfully positive horizontal that cuts across this part of the wall.  It isn't quite over yet with a few more technical moves remain before the shuts.
content.location: From the buttress with a slot you can walk through, go down and around to the far side and you will find this long route starting from the lowest point on the far side going straight up.  Walk the Plank share its start but breaks left after a few bolts.

content.description:
Starts in a left facing dihedral/slot, moves up through 2 bolts, then step right around the corner onto the face and up onto a ledge. Move up-left towards the anchors through sustained 10 moves through more bolts to gain the anchors.

Note: After clipping the last bolt and approaching the anchors, the ledge out left can look  inviting, but it makes it impossible to clip the anchors without downclimbing. Instead, as you near the top, move a bit right for some nice holds and a stance as you clip the anchors.
content.location: At the far end of Impact Zone, starts just to the climber's left of the large boulders that you have to descend to continue down the trail towards Shipwreck.

content.description: Climb up through some rock where you don't want to fall, clip the first bolt and then go straight up through 3 more bolts to the anchors. The crux is the thin, but good holds between the third and fourth bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts and bolted anchors. If you don't feel confident, stick clip the first bolt because a tumble would send you off of a rather high ledge.
content.location: Go through the cave/hole to the left of Trident to a ledge that is above the main trail. Turn around and look up above the mouth of the mouth of the cave. The climb furthest right and above the cave is Anchors Away. Please be careful about picking a belay spot so you don't block the trail on the ledge, and to not knock loose rocks onto the main trail below.
